name: This NYC Restaurant Lets You Gamble For A Free Dinner—And People Are Actually Winning
description: Who doesn’t like the sound of afreedinner? At NYC’s & SON Steakeasy, you’re able to roll dice for the chance to have your bill completed erased. The restaurant recently launched itsnew happy hour, known as 7 before 7. Essentially, if you pay your check before 7pm, you have the opportunity to roll dice. If you roll a 7, your meal is on & SON.

name: Cult Thai Favorite Fish Cheeks To Debut In Williamsburg With Exclusive Dishes & Cocktails
description: Though finding authentic–and good–Thai food can seem like an impossible feat depending on where you live, weNew Yorkers are spoiled with the amount ofThai restaurantsworth dining atthat can be found sprinkled around our city. One of our favorites: Fish Cheeks. Fish Cheeks has proudly held the title of one of NYC’s most beloved Thai restaurants for nearly a decade, and Brooklynites can finally get in on the fun without having to cross the East River thisMayas therestaurant makes its long-awaited debut inWilliamsburg! Fish Cheeks is named for the lean, tender cheek meat that is considered the tastiest part of a fish and is considered a delicacy in Asia. A gold mine of delicious flavors waiting to be explored, Fish Cheeks is known for itsseafood-forward Thai cooking and menu of unabashedly intense, fresh, and vivid dishes.

name: The Dollar Cheese Slice Is Back, As Seamless Revives A Tasty Piece Of NYC History
description: Few things capture the essence of New York food culture quite like a classic cheese slice. People cross boroughs – and even borders – just to get a taste. And when the slice costs a dollar? Well, that’s just the extra cheese on top. From April 22-May 20,Seamless is bringing back the legendary $1 slice, giving locals an affordable and delicious taste of nostalgia.

name: These Dreamy Mother’s Day Brunches In NYC Are Booking Up Fast — Don’t Miss Out
description: Treat the mother figure in your life to thebrunchshe deserves onMother’s Daythis year! From your regular, everyday brunch to one accompanied withlive jazz music and complimentary cocktails,your mama deserves the best of the best, and there’s no shortage of great mother’s day brunch ideas and places you can take her to. Here’s where you need to book a Mother’s Day brunch in NYC before they’re all booked. BookValerienow, so you can try out their special brunch onSunday, May 11thwith Mom. The Midtown cocktail bar/restaurant is serving a signature meal, complete withEggs Benedict variations (like Fried Chicken and Roasted Pork Belly), alongsideAçai bowls, Dutch Baby pancakes, tea-infused gin and tonics, and an English breakfast.

userId: Source / Leonard J. DeFrancisci,CC BY-SA 3.0, via Wikimedia Commons
name: America’s First Pizzeria Has Served Slices In Manhattan’s Little Italy For 120 Years
description: NYCpizzais a sacred thing, and we New Yorkers take this food group veryyyy seriously. So whilepickle pizzadid certainly catch us off guard (though we’d be lying if we said we weren’t slightly intrigued) whatdoesn’tcatch us off guard is the fact thatAmerica’s first pizzeria, Lombardi’s, stands right here in NYC. Honestly, where else would it stand? ! Even more, it’s celebrating its 120th birthday this year!

name: Self-Made Food Critic Keith Lee To Host A Brand New, Family-Friendly Food Fest In NYC This May
description: When self-made food critic Keith Lee announced he was in NYC back in 2023, he had us New Yorkers in a frenzy–we were throwing out suggestions left and right of where he should eat during his stay like our rent was due! So you can imagine our excitement when we heard that not only would Lee be returning to NYC thisMay, but he’d be doing so in order toheadline his own family-friendly food festival,and you alreadyknowhow we feel about a food festival (we’re obsessed with them). If you’re unfamiliar withKeith Lee, he’s aformer MMA fighter-turned-social media food criticwhose viral food review videos can essentially make or break a restaurant. He’s since amassed a whopping 17M followers on Tik Tok alone, all of who rely on his 1-10 ratings when scoping out the next place to grab a bite to eat. So it only makes sense that the social media personalityhosts his own food festivalin one of thebest foodie cities in the world!

name: 10 Delicious Passover Specials In NYC To Order Before Next Week’s Holiday
description: Chag Sameach! Passoveris a time of reflection and celebration for those of Jewish heritage, when the community commemorates their ancestors’ exodus from Egypt and the end of slavery for their people. It comes with many traditions — from holding Seder on the first night with prayers and symbolic food items, to reading the story from the Book of Exodus in the Torah — and of course, lots of delicious (unleavened) dishes that have been passed down through generations. This year, Passover begins atsundown Saturday, April 12thandends at sundown on Sunday, April 20th. Many NYC institutions have special Passover menus and treats that you can enjoy in-person or bring home to celebrate the holiday with loved ones.

name: This Airline Is Now Serving Snail & Garlic Ice Cream En Route To France
description: Over here at Secret NYCwe’re not unfamiliar with unique eats–Honey Badger, one of NYC’s most interesting restaurants and one of our favs, is serving cured jellyfish and pine cones over in Brooklyn (do NOT knock it til you try it! ). And this airline is hopping on the bandwagon, serving its passengers much more than your average Biscoff cookie and ginger ale. EasyJet has recently unveiled a rather out-of-the-box in-flight menu of eats–on the menu:snail and garlic ice cream. The pungent nosh is quite the creation, a sweet and salty pairing, if you will.

name: Louis Vuitton’s NYC Café Debuts With $34 Monogram Ravioli, $9 Cappuccinos, & More
description: More than just fashionistas are now walking through the doors of Louis Vuitton’s NYC flagship. Back in November 2024 the multi-billion-dollar French fashion house opened the doors toits first U. S. eatery, Le Café, and it’s since become a true feast for the senses. The elegant Art Deco café, which is nestled on the fourth floor of the luxury designer’s new Midtown flagship location, exudes French charm with a decadent menu to match, and prices have recently been unveiled.

name: One Of America’s Most Beautiful Restaurants Is Just 1 Hour From NYC — And It’s Pure Monet Magic
description: It’sfinallyspring— so bring on all thetulips,cherry blossomsandorchids! Of course New York has its fair share of sights, but if you make the trip over state lines to New Jersey you can experience even more floral magic. Besides having themost cherry blossom trees in the entire country(yes, more thanD. C. !

description: There’s not much New Yorkers love than eating and drinking with friends, especially when it’s cheap! And with the weather only getting colder, people are ready to enjoy winter season with some delicious cocktails and light bites. description: Ever have an Irish Coffee atThe Dead Rabbitin FiDI? It’s kind of a magical experience. The belovedIrish cocktail barthat’s been racking up awards (including theWorld’s Best BarandBest Bar in North America) since 2013 should be at the top of everyone’s bar bucket list, especially withSt. Patrick’s Daycoming up. But have you wondered how the name came to be…because we must admit “The Dead Rabbit” isquitethe interesting name for a bar.

description: Just in case you didn’t know, welaunched ourSecret Clubat the end of last year—creating an intimate, online community that receives fantastic perks and benefits to use across London. From a monthly discount to use on the best plans and events throughout the capital, to exclusive partnerships with our favourite local businesses, it’s the best way to feel like an NYC VIP for the low, low price of$1. 99 a month; that’s a lot less than your daily iced latte! As well as all the brilliant benefits, our Secret Club members have beensharing incredible recommendationsthatwe just have to share with you. Whether you’re looking for somewhere chill to throw back some craft beer, or something a little more classy for a couple of cocktails, our Secret Club members know what’s what, and you can be a part of the action too!

name: Cult-Favorite Radio Bakery Opens Second NYC Location With Ungodly Lines
description: If you’ve ever strolled past India Street in Greenpoint and wondered what everyone was waiting in line for, it was undoubtedly to get a taste ofRadio Bakery‘s innovative offerings, from heirloom tomato croissants to earl grey morning buns. Lucky for us, New Yorkers have another opportunityto wait in lineat Radio Bakery’snew Prospect Heights locationat 186 Underhill Avenue. Now you may be thinking, why would I stand in a line that goes around the block for pastries? I did too. That is, until IhadRadio Bakery.

name: Zoë Kravitz Spills Her Favorite Things To Do & Places To Eat In NYC
description: Zoë Kravitz’s ability to radiate cool girl energy is effortless, and our desperate desire to recreate it for ourselves is a never-ending feat. So when she spills on the places she likes to frequent in New York City there’s only one thing we’re going to do: give her our undivided attention. In a recentinterviewwith Elle regarding the 2024 release of her directorial debut,Blink Twice,Kravitz unveiled some of her favorite things you can find her doing and places you can find her eating around the city. Kravitz has been living in NYC for two decades–she was raised between Los Angeles, where her mom lived, and NYC andMiamiwhere her dad lived after her parents’ split. Sorry, though, toour friends over in LA–Kravitz may like NYC better (but who doesn’t?

description: NYC is home to an endless amount ofrestaurantsto try. However, some places go above and beyond just mouthwatering fare to create jaw-dropping environments that tantalize more than your taste. From dramatic pendants suspended in the air to floor-to-ceiling glass windows, we have put together a collection of the most beautiful restaurants in NYC. name: You Can Order An Adult Happy Meal At This NYC Steakhouse, Complete With A Martini, Caesar Salad, & Truffle Fries
description: This just in: happy meals aren’t just for kids. Not if you’re dining at American Cut, at least. This beloved NYCsteakhouseis putting a grown-up twist on the nostalgic meal, serving anadult happy meal aptly dubbed The NYC Happy Meal,and the NYC girly pops are going to eat this sh*t up–literally–as are we! The happy mealcombines three of our favorite things: a martini, a caesar salad, and truffle fries. And no, it won’t run you hundreds of dollars.

name: The Smell Of Pizza Can Ease Anxiety & Boost Your Mood, According To Science
description: After we recently unveiled bad news to those that love tostart their morning off with a BEC, it’s only right that we now share some good news, and boy are we delivering! Apparently,pizzais good for much more than just satisfying us in the wee hours of the morning after a wild night out–it can actually ease stress and anxiety and boost our mood! All things that we already could’ve told you ourselves, of course, but definitely cool to now have some science backing us up! Researchers over at the University of East Anglia in Norwich, England conducted a biometric analysis and found thatsmelling a freshly baked pizza led to alleviated stress, anxiety, and nerves. The study was conducted by Professor Oli Buckley in collaboration with Chicago Town, who, in preparation for Euros 2024, were curious if the aroma of a bakingpizzacould lessen anxiety before and during watching a football match.

name: 20 Best Rooftop Bars In NYC For Cooler Weather
description: Some people might chalk uprooftop barsas a summer activity, but us New Yorkers love the sky-high views all year round. Whether you’re a seasoned veteran at rooftop partying, or just want to get a glimpse of the skyline during the cooler months, we got some options for you. We’re talking everything fromretractable roofstofireplaces and even igloos. Check them out below and plan your visit today! (Also note: thecozy Rockefeller Center chaletswon’t be around much longer, so if you’re interested in booking a reservation, do so ASAP!

name: 10 Best Dive Bars In NYC For Cheap Drinks & Good Times
description: Let’s be honest, there’s plenty of places to drink in New York City. But nothing hits quite like a gooddive bar. With menus plastered with cheap drinks and unbeatable shot combo deals, it’s that kind of grungy atmosphere and feeling that just feels so right. But what makes a good dive bargood? It’s not just about being superold, but insteadthat ambianceof dim lights, neon signs, regular bar-goers, and simple food menus.

name: The 10+ Best Steakhouses In NYC To Try Now
description: Steakhousesare dining staples here in NYC, and snagging a reservation at one of these establishments is bound to leave an impression. (And satisfy those hunger pangs! ) While some locations on our list have been servingrib-eyesandNew York stripsfor years, others are fairly new to the the city’s dining scene. One thing is for sure: you can’t go wrong with any of the selections on our list below. Should you want even more dinner inspo, have a look at our favoriteburgers in NYCandbest delis in NYC.

name: 32 Amazing Things To Do In Astoria, Queens
description: Table Of Contents Astoria is known for its rich Greek influence, but thismulticultural neighborhoodhas a lot more than some deliciousGreek foodto offer. Here’s our neighborhood guide to Astoria, soyou have the inside scoopon all the best places to go, things to see, and bites to eat. The VEGOIST @ No5 is the perfect spot to head to forbrunchfor two main reasons: 1. it has a fullveganmenu and a full regular menu, and 2. itoffers two different brunch deals–both of which are fabulous.

name: Pickle Pizza Is Here, & It Was Inspired By Manhattan’s Jewish Delis
description: The gasp we gusped when we sawpickle pizza is now a thingwas probably heard all the way in theUpper East Side(we’re in our office inSoHo, for reference). And though we’re constantly begging for our belovedpizzato be left alone–like, who would eventhinkto put pineapple on something so sacred–we’d be lying if we said we weren’t slightly intrigued. After a couple years in the making, cauliflower crust brand Caulipower recently unveiled their newest creation: a dill pickle pizza. Thepizzameshes togethertangy dill pickle brine, creamy béchamel, roasted garlic, melty mozzarella, and fresh dillall atop the brand’s iconic stone-fired cauliflower crust. And would you hate us if we said we’ddefinitelytry it?

name: You Can Buy Girl Scout Cookies From This Troop In The NYC Shelter System
description: Our favorite season, Girl Scout cookie season, is in full swing! And if you’re wonderingwhere you can buy Girl Scout cookies in NYC, may we suggest purchasing your cookies fromGirl Scouts Troop 6000. Launched in 2017, Girl Scouts of Greater New York’s Troop 6000 is a first-of-its-kind programdesigned to serve families living in temporary housing in the New York City shelter system. It was created so families going through homelessness could still participate in the Girl Scout experience. Each week the Troop holds meetings in shelters across the city, allowing members to“take part in activities that help them make new friends, earn badges, and learn to see themselves as leaders,”according to their website.

name: 17 Best Margaritas In NYC You Should Be Sipping On
description: With National Margarita Day arriving later this month, we know it’s time to take advantage of the “holiday” and get our drink on! And while we don’t agree that we should only spend one day out of 365 celebrating this fruity (or spicy) drink, that’s not stopping us from celebrating it all the same—and there’s no shortage of delicious margaritas around New York City just waiting to be sipped! So, would you like yours frozen or on the rocks? What about a sweet or salty rim? Regardless of your preference, we’re sharing.

name: 30 Most Romantic Restaurants In NYC To Try Right Now
description: There’s so much to do in NYC with a significant other, from a fine dining experience, to spending an intimate day withfamous artwork, or even just sitting on aparkbench at Washington Square Park. Our favorite thing, however, is food. So in the spirit of loveand food, we’ve put togethersome of NYC’s most romantic restaurants(both indoor and outdoor) perfect for date night. name: 19 Best Bakeries In NYC For Mouth-Watering Cake, Sweets, And More
description: New York City is a wonderland for people with a sweet tooth! We have the bestcookies,croissants,cakes, and everything in between! Magnolia Bakery is one of NYC’s most iconic bakery chains, boasting locations all over the city.

name: NYC Steakhouse Legend Wolfgang Zwiener Dies at 85
description: RestauranteurWolfgang Zwiener,the brains behind the wildly popularWolfgang Steakhouse, has passed away at 85 on January 23rd, 2025 at his home in Honolulu. Though his globalsteakhousechain is a legend in its own right,Zwienergot his start at the iconicPeter Luger, one of themost legendary restaurants in the world. He remained there for 39 years. Naysayers worried he wouldn’t have the chops to transition into such a powerful new role, but upon the restaurant’s 2004 opening, his business has only grown. There are dozens ofWolfgang’s Steakhouselocations across the U.

name: 10 Best Deals For NYC’s Winter Restaurant Week 2025
description: Sure it’s cold and the couch in your apartment feels particularly alluring, butRestaurant Weekdeals are worth a stroll through thePolar Vortex. (Trust us! ) FromJanuary 21st to February 9th, 2025,some ofNYC’s best restaurantsare serving up fantastic dishes at enticing prices — pre-fixe selections from $30, $45, and $60 — and we’re never inclined to deny ourselves a good deal. Plus, options and cuisines abound across the five boroughs, so why not indulge? We don’t know about you, but we’re booking our reservations as we speak.

name: Pip’s Bar & Grille From ‘Severance’ Is A Real Place, & It’s Only 2.5 Hours From NYC
description: If you were to tell us your outie was planning on having a meal at Pip’s Bar & Grille in the town of Kier, we’d tell you you’re stuck in a daydream aboutSeverance. However, if you were to tell us you were planning on having a meal at thePhoenicia Diner in the Catskills,we’d tell you you’re bringing the fictional storyline ofSeveranceto life. And, well, we’d also be asking to tag along! Season two of psychological thrillerSeverancepremiered on Friday, January 17th. And those who’ve already seen the series thus far may havenoticed a familiar establishmentif they’ve spent any time in the Catskills–Phoenicia Diner.

name: Here’s How The U.S. Ranked In The 2025 Bocuse d’Or, One The World’s Most Prestigious Cooking Competitions
description: Every other year since 1987, the best chefs around the world have been pitted against each other in a bit of friendly competition, the Bocuse d’Or. The event, which was named for Chef Paul Bocuse, takes place near the end of January in Lyon, France, and isone of the most prestigious cooking competitions in the world. Beyond being a competition, though, it’s a way to celebrate chefs around the world and their passion for cooking at its core, with three chefs taking to the podium at each edition. This year the competition happened on January 26th and 27th, andthe 2025 results are in! According to an Instagram post from Bocuse d’Or, theUnited States ranked seventhin the iconic competition, with a total score of 1852.

name: 15 Best New Restaurants In NYC To Dine At Right Now
description: The NYC dining scene is forever changing, and although that meanslosing some classic favorites, it also means gaining some new must-visit spots. description: While Santa is busy making a list, you should be busy making a reservation: thebest restaurants open on Christmas in NYCfill up quickly, and there’s still time to get your table! WithDecemberofficially here, that meansholiday seasonis too…which means charming events likecandlelit concerts, festive markets and more. Why not get a jump start before the festivities begin? You don’t want to risk getting closed out of your favorite spot, do you? Here are a few of thebest restaurants open on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day in NYC.

name: The Best Hot Chocolate In NYC: 15 Spots To Visit This Winter
description: Our favoritewintertimesips will always bebest hot chocolate in NYC(with a dollop of whipped cream…andmaybeeven a drizzle of hot fudge if we’re feeling adventurous). Once the weather plummets, we can’t help but crave a sweet, warm treat. Fortunately, there are plenty of eateries around the city that take cocoa to unthinkable levels. (Need we say more about the out-of-this-worldGlace S’mores Hot Chocolate? ) Some spots even add a frozen effect to the drink.

name: 30 Best Venues In NYC To Host Your Holiday Party This Year
description: Now thatholiday seasonis ramping up, you’ll probably be spending some time with friends, family, and coworkers. If you plan on throwing aprivate event, holiday get-together, or even a traditional office party, you’ve got to have a place to do it! Depending on the size of your guest-list, price range, and overall atmosphere, there’s a ton at stake to consider when choosing a place. To make it a little easier (and to let you know about them before they’re all booked), we put together a list of thebest places around NYC for a private holiday party! The Landing inMidtownis the perfect spot to throw an event, thanks to theirtwo gorgeous private roomsthat can host anything from a holiday happy hour to a group dinner.

name: Here Are Tom Holland’s Favorite NYC Restaurants
description: As cool, calm, and collected New Yorkers we wouldneverbother a celebrity when we see them out and about in the wild–especially when they’re eating. But whether it beBillie Eilish’s favorite NYC vegan restaurants,Michael Imperioli’s favorite NYC Italian restaurants,Action Bronson’s favorite NYC restaurants, orTimothee Chalamet’s favorite NYC eats, wedoget a bit nosy when it comes to know which spots celebs love to grab a bite at in NYC. In an interview with the Infatuation,Tom Holland dished on some of his favorite NYC restaurants,saying, “I love New York especially, [there’s] great dining in New York. ” So if you’re looking to dine like Holland, or simply just want a new local spot to try, here’s where you should go: MAMO restaurant is anItalian restaurantborn in the heart of SoHo. Serving up a“modern twist on Italian nostalgia,”MAMO offers dishes like Artichokes alla Giudia, Octopus and Chickpea Salad, Halibut in foil with Puttanesca Sauce, and Roast Chicken with Seasonal Vegetables.

name: Satisfy Your Inner Child With PB&J Cake At Hani’s, NYC’s Hottest New Bakery
description: Hani’s(pronounced “Honey’s”) Bakery iswhiskingNew Yorkers off their feet with an incredibly complex menu of pastries you never knew you needed. Opened by husband and wife duo, Miro (former pastry chef of Gramercy tavern) and Shilpa (Senior Food Editor atBon Appétitmagazine) Uskokovic, Hani’s is an homage to Miro’s late mother who had always aspired to own a bakery. Growing up in Serbia, Miro would unfailingly come home to a cake made my his mother on the table. Baking was not only her joy and escape but a respite from work on the family farm. This new bakery honors her and a dream fulfilled.

name: New York Is Home To More Romantic Restaurants Than Any Other State
description: With thewinterapproaching you know what that means: it’s cuffing season–and if you don’t agree with this don’t shoot the messenger, rather, take it up with Urban Dictionary who first coined the term in 2011. And if you find yourself in New York for cuffing season you’re in the right place as a new study has revealedNew York has the most romantic restaurants than any other state–pretty convenient for all those cuffing seasondates! Tripadvisor found each state’s 10 most populous cities that they’d consider “romantic,” and video chat roulette site Instacams. com then analyzed the percentage of restaurants in these cities to reveal which states have the most romantic ones. And, according to the data, New York has taken the top spot as being home to more romantic restaurants than any other state.

name: 22 Charming Things To Do In Chelsea, Manhattan
description: Roughlyrunning from 14th Street to 30th Street between Seventh Avenue and the Hudson Riveryou’ll find Manhattan’s neighborhood of Chelsea. Home to hundreds of art galleries, Chelsea is New York City’s premiere arts district, but culture buffs aren’t the only ones traveling from across the globe to check out this neighborhood. Fromspeakeasiesand excellent eateries to fabulous markets you could spend days here exploring all there is to do, and honestly it could get quite overwhelming. Lucky for you, we’re sharing all best things to eat, see, and do next time you find yourself among the streets of this expansive west side neighborhood. Here’sourultimate guide to Chelsea: Table Of Contents Though the OASES restaurant just opened it’s way more than that–it’s a full wellness haven that will awaken all five of your senses.

name: These 4 NYC Bars Were Named Among The World’s 50 Best
description: We’re over here feeling like we’re suffering from a case of déjà vu–earlier this month World’s 50 Best released theirBest Bars 51-100 listand four New York City bars made the cut…but that’s not all! When looking at theWorld’s 50 Best Bars 1-50 list,four moreNew York City bars made the cut! Though when NYC’s bar scene is the way it is, what with itsunique barsexuding quirky vibes,tiki barsfor soaking up tropical vibes,hidden barswith secret entrances, and more, we’re never surprised when the city finds its way onto a best bars list (…or abest restaurants listfor that matter! ) Now in its 16th edition, the World’s 50 Best Bars awards unite the global bar community in recognition of the bartenders, bar owners, and brands at the forefront of the international cocktail scene. The 2024 World’s 50 Best Barslistfeatures bars from 28 citieswith 16 new entries spread across Bangkok, Bogotá, Guadalajara, Hong Kong, Lima, Melbourne, Mexico City, Milan, New York, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, and Tokyo.

name: This NYC Restaurant Only Hires Grandmas To Cook Their Family Dishes
description: In search of Grandma’s cooking? Well this NYC restaurantemploys Grandma’s from all over the world to work in its kitchen. Through cooking, Staten Island’s Enoteca Maria has been serving handed down recipes, cooked by nonnas from every country to hungry customers. Brooklyn-born Jody Scaravella founded the restaurant with a mission to share his grandmother’s Italian culinary culture. Originally, he hired a few Italian grandma’s to serve their own rotating menus.

userId: Source / Tasca on the UWS has unlimited sangria for just $15. Photo courtesy Tasca.
name: 25 Unbeatable Bottomless Brunches In NYC That Won’t Disappoint
description: Bottomless brunch is the perfectweekend activity, year-round. Sunny and gorgeous outside? Soak it in with some outdoor day drinking at bottomless brunch. Cold and gross outside? Cozy up to bottomless mimosas with friends for the day.

name: Billie Eilish’s 23 Favorite Restaurants In NYC
description: NYC’s dining scene is quite unmatched–there’s a reason we’re constantly making lists likeTripadvisor’s Travelers’ Choice Awards Best of the BestandWorld’s 50 Best–and, well, all the celebrities know it too. From the lateAnthony BourdaintoSopranosstarMichael Imperioliand evenThe Bear’sJeremy Allen White, we love discovering our favorite celebs’ favorite restaurants, andBillie Eilish just revealed her favorite plant-based restaurants in NYC! For context, Eilish, who continues to makeefforts to minimize the eco-footprint of her world tours,has partnered up with Google Maps as part of her Hit Me Hard and Soft tour to help fans find eco-friendly transportation and plant-based food options in many of the cities her 43-city world tour is making stops in. So, before seeing her at MSG on October 16, 17, or 18, you can grab a bite to eat at one of her favorite spots! Eilish stated: Adopting a plant-based diet is one of the most impactful ways you can help heal our planet.

name: These 9 NYC Restaurants Are Among The Best In The World, Says Tripadvisor Travelers
description: Each year, Tripadvisor sifts through reviews and ratings collected over the prior 12 months and awards travelers’ favorite destinations, hotels, restaurants, and things to do around the world. And while many awards, such asWorld’s 50 Best, are granted by food critics and a panel of judges, Tripadvisor’s Travelers’ Choice Awards Best of the Best are awarded by us; real travelers from all over the world sharing our opinions and stories! And of the many, many restaurants from all over the world that made the restaurant portion of the Travelers’ Choice Awards Best of the Best for 2024,nine are New York City’s very own restaurants! The nine NYC restaurants that made the cut are as follows: For when you’re feeling bougie, like white tablecloths, best-in-class chefs, and unforgettable bites bougie, try heading to one of these fine dining restaurants. This category focused on restaurants from all over the world andincluded a total of 25 restaurants.

userId: Source / Eataly rendering at JFK T8
name: JFK To Welcome The First Eataly At Any U.S. Airport By 2025
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, along with American Airlines and Unibail-Rodamco-Westfield (URW) Airports, have just announced a lineup of 21 hot new brands to open at JFK’s Terminal 8, continuing efforts to transform one of the busiest transportation hubs in America to a world-renowned airport and global gateway. One of the brands includes the beloved Italian marketplace,Eataly, marking the first U. S. airport location to date. Customers will be able to experience the beautiful culture and delicious tastes ofItaly, regardless of their final destination.

name: 16 Best Diners In NYC For A Memorable And Classic Meal
description: Nothing says New York like the classic image of the24-hour dinerpacked with people catching up on the day’s news over a cup of coffee. Alone or with friends, diners have always been an important part of the landscape of the city, and one that locals take much pride in. You more than likely already have a favorite place or two where you’re a regular yourself. However, nothing says New York like trying new things, and there’s always new diners to be found. Check out our picks for thefreshest and best diners in NYCyou’ve gotta check out!

name: Katz’s Deli Launches A Vegetarian Pastrami Sandwich For One Day Only
description: Though NYC’s iconic Katz’s Delicatessen has been serving up its legendary pastrami on rye since 1888, for the past 136 years vegetarians all around the city have unfortunately had to ignore their watering mouths and admire thesandwichfrom afar. But guess what–that’s all about to come to an end! Well…for one day, at least. This weekendKatz’s Delicatessen will team up with seed-to-table pioneer Row 7 for a one-day-only event that will reimagine Katz’s classic pastrami sandwich in a groundbreaking way:with a meatless version! Katz’s and Row 7 have been experimenting with crafting an unexpected new take on pastrami for quite some time, preserving all the smoky, complex flavors pastrami eaters have come to know and love minus the cow!

name: Brooklyn’s Nearly Century-Old Kellogg’s Diner Makes A Major Comeback
description: Though NYC claims to never sleep, I think we can all agree we’ve found ourselves cursing out our local dines for closing before midnight. However, there was always one establishment that kept true to NYC’s24-hourreputation, and that isKellogg’s Diner. Now that’s not to say thisnearly century-old dinerdidn’t face many challenges: pandemic restrictions, Chapter 11 bankruptcy, Chapter 7 bankruptcy, and so on. The establishment evenwent up for sale last yearafter former owner, Irene Siderakis, owed creditors $750,000. But again it prevails, as Chef Jackie Carnesi and Louis Skibar have stepped in to save the day.

name: Climb Aboard A Bus From NYC To Bangkok At Williamsburg’s Most Unique Restaurant
description: Ever dreamed of visiting Thailand? Well now you can—in Williamsburg! And no, we’re not just talking about an exceptionally goodThai restaurantthat will transport your tastebuds; we’re talking about an entirebus tour through the streets and canals of Bangkokwhile you’re served dishes native to the country. You’d nearly miss BangBang Bangkok on Grand Street, if not for the tiny neon sign confirming you’re at the right place. Upon entering, you’ll be greeted at the door and offered a seat to grab a drink before the tasting menu begins.

userId: Source / The Standard High Line, Oktoberfest
name: The Standard, High Line Is Throwing A NYC-Style Block Party For Oktoberfest
description: Enter to win 2 VIP tickets to The Standard, High Line’s Oktoberfest celebration AND a stay in one of their King rooms! 💤 The giveaway is open until September 17 at 12pm EST. Try your luck right here: Did you knowOktoberfestdoesn’t start until the mayor of Munich screams“O’zapt is! ”(“it’s open! ”) as he taps the firstbeer barrelof the festival?

userId: Source / Jason Varney for Rockwell Group
name: These 8 NYC Restaurants Recently Found Their Way Onto The Michelin Guide
description: AMichelin star restaurantemanates an air of luxury, andNew York City is no stranger to the Michelin Guide. Though there are already tons of NYC restaurants on the Guide, more continue to find their way onto the list, and if you’re looking for a new place to dine we certainly can trust the recs of someone whose job is to travel all over the country with one purpose: finding the best restaurants. Earlier thissummerthe2024 Michelin Guide New Yorkwas released, andeight NYC restaurants made the cut! The restaurants offer an array of cuisines, ranging from fromIndianandKoreantoMediterraneanandMexican, and together they bring NYC’s total number of Michelin-recommended restaurants to 399. To clarify: the addition of these restaurants doesn’t mean they’ve received a star, ratherthey’re recommended by the Michelin Guide team.

name: The Best Things To Eat & Drink At The US Open This Year
description: WithUS Open Fan Weekwrapping up this weekend and thefull tournamentscheduled to begin soon, it’s time to make your annual outing to Flushing for some tennis and food. This year’s US Open is set to be another special tournament, welcoming thesport’s biggest namesand some ofNYC’s hottest food and drink vendors. Bookmark this guide for when you go this year, because we’re putting you on to thebest places to eat and drink at the US Open this year. One of NYC’s food institutions,Carnegie Deli, is popping up at the US Open in 2024, and they’ll be serving their iconic menu items all tournament long. The two are teaming up to serve a menu including thefamous Hot Pastrami sandwich, as well asJumbo New York Hot Dogs, Hot Corned Beef sandwiches, Roasted Turkey Breast sandwiches, New York Cheesecake, and Giant Black and White Cookies.

name: This 2-Night Food Fest Is Bringing The Boldest Latin American & Caribbean Flavors To NYC
description: We hope you’re hungry because this September theNY Latin Food Fest is bringing a culinary carnivalstraight toPier 76. Visitors will eat their way through endless Latin American andCaribbeanflavors without even having to hop on a plane! The festival isthe work of MASC Hospitality Group,the same ones behind other NYC favorites includingBronx Night Market,Uptown Night Market,Vegan Night Market, and Brooklyn Night Market–so we justknowit’s going to be delicious. Attendees will be able to feast on300+ mouthwatering Latin and Caribbean-inspired dishes. Think: zestytacos, savory mofongo, hearty feijoada, and more!

name: 18 Gorgeous Hotel Bars In NYC You Should Be Drinking At Right Now
description: NYC is home to many things…includingcool hotelsto spend a night at,rooftop barsto take in a view, and so much more. But what about the best of the both worlds? What many New Yorkers don’t realize is the beauty and underratedness of grabbing a drink at a hotel bar across the city! You don’t even have to be a guest! Usually with stunning ambiance and innovative cocktail menus, these spots create a chic environment that is hard to replicate!

name: 10 Best NYC Boat Parties & Booze Cruises For The Summer
description: Is there a better way to spend a summer afternoon than cruising around NYC waters with some boozy drinks? We think not! It’s time to grab your crew and hit the open waters for a day (or night! ) of fun. We gathered up some of our favoriteNYC booze cruisesthat are perfect for sipping on tasty cocktails, dancing the night away, or even just grabbing some food.

name: 7 Freshest Fish Markets In NYC To Buy Your Seafood At
description: If you’re aseafood loverin NYC, it’s safe to say you’re pretty spoiled. Not only is there some of the world’sbest seafood restaurants all around the city, but you can easily scour some of thefresh, high-quality oceanic delights for yourself. There’s plenty of world-classfish markets around NYCto pick up the latest catch, including theworld’s second largest one in Fulton Fish Market. Next time you’re in search of some striped sea bass or you need some lobster to finish off your next big dinner, these are the places to go. Lobster Place residesinside the famous Chelsea Market, where you can stop and check out their offerings as you stroll through the namesake location.

userId: Source / Kokos at Peal Alley, Pier 17
name: 5 Reasons You Can’t Miss Dining At Kokos This Summer
description: Get a slice of a tropical islands right in Manhattan. Thisseasonal pop-up Kokos at Pearl Alleyserves up flavors, spirits, food, and the ultimate summer vibes! Dubbed “Kinda Tropical, Kinda New York” this bar and eatery takes the tranquil feeling of a Caribbean escape and puts it right in Downtown Manhattan. We’ve outlined some of our favorite parts of Kokos at Pearl Alley and why you should check it out as part of your summer plans! It’s warm, inviting and it has Cabana seating.

name: Dirty Martini Dip, Caprese Martinis, & More Creations To Dig Into On National Martini Day
description: Whether you prefer it shaken or stirred, you can’t deny the classic elegance of a martini. Sothis Junewe’ve got our eye on one specific date: Wednesday, June 19th. Why, you may ask? Because it’sNational Martini Day, of course! But if you ask us a National Martini Day celebration deserves way more than gin, vermouth, and a lemon peel.

name: 30 Best Rooftop Bars In NYC To Drink At Right Now
description: Summeris just about here and the weather is amazing, which means it’s time to get outside and enjoy a rooftop drink! If there’s one thing about New Yorkers, it’s that we love a good drink…and a view! From Midtown mainstays to brand new spots, here are some of thebest rooftop bars in NYC go grab a drink! Cheers! This swanky spot in the sky comes from award-winning Chef José Andrés.

name: 8 Best Night Markets In NYC To Grub At This Season
description: Springis here andsummertimeis on the horizon, and that means thereturn of our beloved night markets! Alongside NYC’sflea marketsandfarmer’s markets, the night-time gatherings are some of our favorite ways to spend a warm night–eatinglocal, delicious food from NYC vendors. Below, we’ve rounded up all of thenight markets returning this seasonand when you can visit them! This year marks the 9th season of The Queens Night Market in Flushing Meadows Corona Park! It’sfreeto the public and is open to the public on Saturday nights throughout the spring and summer.

name: NYC’s Vegan Night Market Has Returned For The Season
description: Once the weather warms up us New Yorkers go feral for spending time outdoors, and all the city’snight marketsmake it easy to do so. And considering NYC is thethird most vegan-friendly city in the world, we were definitely thankful when thecity’s first ever vegan night market made its debut last year. And it has officiallyreturned for its second seasonthis summerthough in a different home this year–Columbus Circle. Attracting both vegans and the vegan-curious alike, the market satisfied the taste buds of3,000 hungry patronseach week with a diverse array ofveganbites. Last year the market featured 25+ micro-businesses offering mouthwatering food and drink options, andthis year’s lineup is just as tasty.

name: NYC’s First & Only Floating Mexican Restaurant Is Open On The Hudson
description: La Barca Cantina offersMexican fareand delicious cocktails afloat! Hop onboard the three-story boat at Pier 81 on the Hudson River and sail around the city for incredible skyline and sunset views with New York Cruise Lines. And it has officially set sail! The boat offers custom artwork by Tlisza Jaurique, the first Mexican-American woman to exhibit at the Met, an incredible top deck for guests to take in the scenery, and most notably, an expansive agave-based spirits menu. Craig Kanarick, Chief Executive Officer of New York Cruise Lines, wasinspired by his travels to Mexico to create this perfect warm weather destination.

name: The Ultimate Guide To Rockaway Beach, Queens: Things To Do + More
description: Summerin NYC is always a hot one, but thankfully with all the differentpools,beaches, andwater sprayersthroughout the city,itispossible to find ways tocool down. Arguably one of NYC’s best beaches is Rockaway Beach, and there’s tons more to do there besides just digging your toes in the sand–plus, it’s completely free! Here is the ultimate guide to Rockaway Beach. Table Of Contents Finding a friend with a car in NYC is like finding a needle in a haystack. So unless you’re one of the lucky ones, you’ll have to rely on public transportation to get to Rockaway Beach–but trust us, it’s not all bad!

name: 13 Best Hot Dogs In NYC You Have To Try Right Now, According To New Yorkers
description: When you think of iconic NYC foods, you may dream ofbagels,pizza, bodegacoffees…and even New York hot dogs. Although most iconically served out of red-and-yellow carts, the range of quality hot dogs stretches far and wide across our great city. From dedicated hot dog joints to Venezuelan street food restaurants,we asked true New Yorkers where to get the best hot dogs in NYC, and the answers did not disappoint. Book mark these spots for next time you’re craving a dog topped in ketchup and mustard. We start with arguably one of NYC’s most iconic hot dogs…Nathan’s Famous.

name: A Guide To The Best Food At Citi Field This Season
description: Let’s go Mets! Citi Field, home to Queen’s favorite baseball team is proudly serving some of the best ballpark food in professional baseball. Along with being named thebest MLB stadium for vegan eaterslast year, we’re excited to share the endless food options the stadium has to offer. We’re talking everything fromsushitofried chickensandwiches to signature milkshakes. Next time you’re at the ballpark, be sure to grab food from one of these awesome vendors.

name: Eat Like Anthony Bourdain: These Are 10 Of Bourdain’s Favorite NYC Restaurants
description: The loss ofAnthony Bourdainwas felt not only in New York but around the world in general–even six years later it still seems surreal. And to this day people are still relying on Bourdain when it comes toeating goodaround the world. Lucky for us, as anNYC native, Bourdain had no shortage of food options he loved around the city–from fancy, Michelin restaurants to NYC’s more questionable dirty water dogs. Soif you’re looking to eat like Bourdain, you’ll definitely want to head to the following spots: Katz’s Deli is one of ourfavorite delis in NYC, and apparently we’re doing something right because it’s one of Anthony Bourdain’s favorites as well. In aYouTube videoshared by Insider Tech, Bourdain notes “we have better deli than you,” and suggests heading to Katz’s Deli, among others, for apastrami sandwich on rye with sour pickles,a Dr.

name: The Best Bars In The Hamptons To Drink At This Summer
description: Withsummerofficially here, you may be starting to think about yourannual trip to theHamptons! A weekend there is the perfect time to unwind, and there’s so much to do…including filling your tummy with as many delicious lobster rolls as possible and of course, grabbing a drink (or two) in the evening. Have a look throughour favorite bars in the Hamptonsto bookmark if you’re down the shore this summer. With great cocktails, live music, and stunning views of Fort Pond, there’s no place like The Surf Lodge. It’s located in Montauk and has become one of thehottest places to drink on the Island.

name: The Best Festivals In NYC Happening This Summer
description: Here in NYC, there’s always something new to see! From rotatingart installationstofree events around the city, there are so many happenings to match any style and personality. Now thatsummeris in full swing, there are tons of event series and festivals you should bookmark on your calendar. Let’s dig into our favorite festivals in NYC that are either happening now or coming up later this summer! The Tribeca Festivalreturns to NYC this June, running fromJune 5 – 16!

name: The Very First Espresso Martini Bar In NYC Is Now Open
description: Not sure what to order from the menu? How about an espresso martini, or the espresso martini, or even an espresso martini? NYC has opened its veryfirst espresso martini bar, solely dedicated to serving up variations of the belovedcoffee-flavoredcocktail. Known as the Rose Room in Queensyard, the drink menu features everything from the classic espresso martini titledThe Gold Standard, to more adventurous creations like theLychee Rose Lovemade with Dorothy Parker Gin, lychee liqueur, limoncello, and espresso. Still unsure how they can create more adaptations?

name: Get into Vacation Mode at Brookfield Place All Summer Long
description: Celebrate Pride with interactive installations and music; enjoy a new photography exhibit as part of Photoville Festival; or cool down with refreshing cocktails by the waterfront and enjoy NYC’s epic summer sunsets. Brookfield Placeis a hidden gem in Lower Manhattan is the best place to be this season! During Pride Month there is so much to do! Engage with two interactive installations that encourage visitors to reflect on diversity and empower each other. Artist Matthew Hoffman’s installation, aptly called “You Are Beautiful,” invites visitors to spread positive affirmations and love to the community.

name: A 2-Week Pickle Pop-Up Returns To The LES This June
description: Listen up pickle lovers–we have some news that’s bound topickleyour fancy! Atwo-week pickle pop-up is once again heading our way! Grillo’s Pickles will be hosting aGrillo’s Pickle World pop-up in theLower East Sidethis June, and if you’re a pickle lover than we’d say it’s a pretty big dill. The pop-up will feature tons oflimited-edition pickled foods,exclusive merch, and more! One of the merch collabs you can get your hands on during the two-week long pop-up Grillo’s Pickles Pickle Pop-Up will be withCheatin Snakes,a streetwear brand that focuses on creating a community of like-minded outcasts through clothing and novelty items.

name: 19 Best Cheap Eats In NYC For An Affordable Bite
description: Living in NYC is about getting the best bang for your buck. Whether it’s scoping out a good spot to eat, or finding a rent-stabilized apartment, it’s no surprise why us New Yorkers look to save wherever we can! One of our favorite inexpensive things to do though, is getting a delicious meal for a steal of a price! This means juicy hamburgers for less than $10, a pile of dumplings for cheap, thick empanadas for a good price, and a whole lot more. These are our favorite places around NYC to find some cheap eats!

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of Victors Cafe
name: 16 Best Cuban Restaurants In NYC To Try This Weekend
description: Fact: New York boasts some of the best food in the world. In particular, the city’s Cuban food scene has been going strong for decades, and some of the best Cuban cuisine chefs have made their homes right here in NYC. Bringing the bright flavors of their home country and taking New Yorkers along for the ride, it’s no secret why we have the closest avant-garde flavors and dishes to Cuba itself. If you’re looking for a little slice of Havana, start planning your visit to one of these best Cuban restaurants in NYC! Located in Harlem near the famous Cotton Club,La Floriditais a Cuban diner featuring a wide assortment of appetizers along with some excellent Cuban entree favorites.

name: 15 Best Karaoke Bars In NYC Where You Can Sing Your Heart Out
description: Almostanyonecan have a great time belting out “I Want It That Way” or “No Scrubs” at the top of their lungs, right? Or, at the least, watchingotherpeople go for it. And there’s no shortage of really great karaoke spots across NYC to become the next star of your friend group. The next time you need a good laugh or want to embrace your inner diva with a microphone, try one of thesetop 16 spots in NYC. From places with private rooms so you only have to sing in front of your friends, to open karaoke bars if you’re feeling extra confident, you’re bound to let go of daily stresses and have an incredible time.

name: There’s A Hidden Fine Dining Restaurant Inside This Subway Station In Koreatown
description: New Yorkers won’t just be passing through the subway station at 32nd Street and Broadway to catch the train, but to enjoy a magnificent dining experience. Nōksu, K-town’s newest restaurant at 49 West 32 Street, has opened at its inconspicuous venue just last fall. Customers must locate the unassuming black doorat the bottom the the stairs in the subway stationandenter a special key code to enter. Once inside, guests will be wowed by the subterranean dining room that was inspired by sumuk-hwa, which are Korean ink wash paintings. The name Nōksu aligns with its underground location as it signifies a deep and clear valley in the mountains.

userId: Source / Courtesy SA 2.0 via Wikimedia Commons
name: A Guide To The Best Food At Yankee Stadium This Season
description: Take us out to the ball game! No visit to Yankee Stadium is complete without some grub, and this is your all-inclusive guide of food and drink at the ballpark! From baseball classics to food and beverage menus curated by high-profile chefs, you can feast and cheer on your New York Yankees in style this season! Here’s all the tasty food at Yankee Stadium you can sink your teeth into this summer! Let’s start with thebrand new offeringsYankee Stadium has this year, ranging from sweet desserts to a brand new beer.

name: These Are NYC’s Top 100 Restaurants For 2024, According To The New York Times
description: If there’s one thing New York City is going to do it’s going to begive us endless opportunities to stuff our faceswith the absolute most delicious food–our city really doesn’t hold back in that department. The only downside: the options can definitely can be a bit overwhelming. Fromwaterfront diningand the city’smost beautiful restaurantsto themost romantic restaurantsandoutdoor dining(shall we go on? ) figuring out where to make your next reservation issure to make your head spin. Thankfully, the New York Times–more specifically restaurant critic Pete Wells–put together a list of New York City’s top 100 restaurants for 2024 based on his decade of reviewing.

name: 15 Prettiest Floral Restaurants In NYC With Outdoor Dining Setups
description: With all of this lovely sunshine, what better way to enjoy the warm weather than dining under floral canopies that will whisk you away to paradise? Here are some of the most gorgeousspringfloral outdoor dining setupsin NYC popping up just in time for spring and summer. P. S. Most of these magical creations are by the fabulousFloratorium— be sure to check them out!

name: Jacob Elordi Apparently Loves This Aussie-Inspired NYC Cafe
description: BetweenEuphoria, Saltburn,andPriscilla,Jacob Elordi has absolutely been having his main character momentas of late, and word on the street is that there’s a cafe in NYC that he loves. And while they may not have his bath water on the menu (sorry, bad joke) they do have some other things we can guarantee you’ll want to give a taste. According to many sources, Jacob Elordi allegedlyloves the Australian restaurant chain Little Ruby’s–specifically theWest Villagelocation–with many a TikToker posting videos about how they saw Elordi and his then girlfriend Kaia Gerber dining there. Though with itsshorefront vibes reminiscent of Down Under and Aussi-inspired foodit’s easy to see why (he is, after all, Australian…just in case you didn’t know). With locations inSoHo, Murray Hill, and both the West andEast Village, Little Ruby’s has beenbringing Australian cafe culture to NYC since 2002.

name: Taylor Swift Frequents This Old School NYC Italian Restaurant
description: One thing about New York City is it knows a thing or two about good dining, and while its known for many a classicItalian restaurants, not many are as loved as Emilio’s Ballato–andits A-list clientele proves that. One celeb in particular who most recently visited the no-frills restaurant–Taylor Swiftherself. Not too long ago Swift was seen dining at the restaurant with the ultimate girl gang–Blake Lively, Sophie Turner, and Brittany Mahomes, among others. A source toldPeople,“They dined in a private room. Everyone had a blast.

name: 13 Tastiest Food Trucks In NYC To Grab A Bite At
description: New York City is no stranger to awesome street food. We all know how big of a melting pot our culinary scene is, so it’s no surprise that mobile trucks driving around delicious food is commonplace too. From mouth-watering tacos to oversized grilled cheeses, you can find just about anything in a food truck, and it’s usually made with love and care. Many food trucks are local businesses have cemented their roots into the NYC food scene, declaring their cuisine as a permanent staple alongside NYC’s restaurants. Now, as the warm weather comes back and you’re out on the go, you may want to stop by one to give it a try.

name: These Are Action Bronson’s Favorite Restaurants In NYC
description: The Queens-born rapper and food enthusiast,Action Bronson, is known for his entertaining food reviews, dining at some of the best establishments across Paris, Tokyo and of course, his hometown, New York City. Though he offers plenty of videos on his YouTube channel highlighting local restaurants throughout the five boroughs, he shared some of his favorites in an interview that went toInstagram. So if you’re trying to dine like him or just looking for a new local spot to try, we’ve listed out some ofAction Bronson’s favorite NYC restaurantsthat he would recommend to someone coming to New York. Beloved for its mouthwateringburger, Red Hook Tavern is a Brooklyn favorite and neighborhood staple. It officially opened for business in 2019, from the same owner as anotherRed Hookfavorite, Hometown BBQ, Billy Durney in 2019.

name: 19 Delicious Black-Owned Restaurants In Brooklyn
description: When it comes toBlack-owned experiences, Brooklyn isabundant. We narrowed down some of our favorite restaurants offeringAmerican,Southern,CaribbeanandAfricancuisine. These eateries celebrate culture, food and individuality and do NOT lack in flavor. Here are some Black-owned restaurants to visit in Brooklyn! View this post on InstagramBamboo Walk is a versatile eatery that offers a range of services including fine dining, cabanas, a robust take-out menu, and the first-ever drive-thru Caribbean restaurant in America.

name: 16 Best Seafood Restaurants In NYC To Feast At Right Now
description: Some of the most highly-rated restaurants in the world make their home here in NYC, and among those are plenty of fresh seafood destinations. With New England’s famous selection of lobster andoystersjust a stone’s throw away, New York offers a wide variety of unique and fresh seafood options that any food lover is bound to enjoy. Whether you’re looking to splurge on a luxury meal in the heart of Manhattan or are simply craving fresh fish n’ chips after a late night, here are 16 of the best seafood restaurants in NYC! In a city with seemingly endless dining options, Le Bernardin remains a NYC staple when it comes to excellent seafood. Created in Paris by sibling duo Maguy and Gilbert Le Coze, Le Bernardin was founded with the goal of always keeping freshly prepared fish at the heart of its elaborate menu.

name: A Two-Level Korean Food Court Just Opened In NYC, And Right Now Everything Is 50% Off
description: Craving Korean tonight? You’re in luck! NYC just welcomed a brand newKorean foodcourt at 1271 Broadway, andeverything is 50% off. The grand opening promotion is running through March 3rd, 2024, so you better check it out fast. The food court offers a variety of traditional and trendy Korean dishes and street food, including cheese coin bread, egg sandwiches by Egg Lab, kimbap, banchan and dosirak (Korean lunch boxes).

name: Nicholas Braun’s (AKA Cousin Greg) NYC Luncheonette Is One Of The Country’s Best Celeb-Owned Restaurants
description: It’s not uncommon tobump into a celebwhen frolicking around NYC, but beyond just passing them on the street you can also dine like them–likegrabbing a bite to eat at a celebrity-owned restaurant! Experts at Q. R. Code Generator analyzed a list of celebrity-owned and invested restaurants all across the United States to see which ones were ranking among the best based on the average total percentage of excellent reviews on Google Reviews. And, according to the data, theseventh best celebrity-invested restaurant is right here in NYC!

name: 8 Best Turkish Restaurants In NYC To Try Right Now
description: Get ready for your tastebuds to head toIstanbul, since New York City’s selection of delicious Turkish restaurants is simply incredible. Places where warm hospitality and divine cuisine mix, you can find all kind of delectable food, fromAnatolian kebabsto thesavory delights of mezes. Next time you’re looking for a Turkish restaurant in NYC, book a table at one of these tasty spots. Nestled right into the heart of theUpper West Side, Leyla is an elegant and cozy little establishment that serves flavors from the Black Sea region of Turkey. Everything in here is stunning, from it’s outward brownstone exterior to the presentation of their food and cocktails.

name: Queens Launches The Ultimate Contest To Determine The Best Bagel In The Borough
description: The age old question of who serves thebest bagel in NYCis getting a bit more official with an actual contest being held by the Queens Chamber of Commerce “Best Bagel Competition. ” Want to ensure your favorite Queens bagel spot makes the cut? You can send in yournominationsup until Friday, January 26th. “Bagels aren’t just breakfast; they’re a daily dose of connection for people as they make a quick stop at their favorite restaurants and bodegas. Whether you like them plain or with everything, smeared with butter or cream cheese, Queens offers some of the best of the doughy delights in the city,” said Tom Grech, President and CEO of the Queens Chamber of Commerce.

name: Here’s Where To Find The Best Food At John F. Kennedy Airport
description: Withholiday seasonapproaching, and2023 set to be the busiest travel year on record, it’s time to start get your planning done ahead of time! Whether it’s when to book your flight, or how to treat yourself…many New Yorkers and tourists are preparing to circle through the doors of JFK International Airport towards the end of this year. To make your life easier while traveling, we’ve put together a list of food and drink options to save you a headache! From grab-and-go pick ups to sit down bars, there’s something for every occasion! Check out all of JFK’s food options below!

userId: Source / Facebook / Le Relais de Venise New York (Official)
name: Pay $34 For A Steak Dinner & Unlimited Fries At This Parisian Steakhouse In NYC
description: Yes, you read that headline correctly. We’re telling you that you can geta complete steak dinner in New York City for just $34. Where you may ask? Well at Paris’ very own beloved steakhouse, Le Relais de Venise, that just reopened an NYC location in Midtown! What makes Le Relais de Venise one of the most unique steakhouses in the world (and arguably why it’s so good at what it does) is that it only has three items on the menu: salad, steak and unlimited fries.

name: Lotte New York Palace Is The Most Magical Place To Be This Holiday Season
description: In the heart of our vibrant city is the timeless and iconic hotel known asLotte New York Palace– or simply,The Palaceto Gossip Girl fans. This unofficial landmark hotel has been the subject of much anticipation and excitement, but it all goes up a notch during the holiday season. After years of meticulous restoration work on the historic Villard Mansion, the hotel is set to usher in theholiday seasonwith a touch ofenchantment and grandeur. The news of the return of themagnificent courtyardChristmas tree, a beloved symbol of festive cheer and wonder, has set the city abuzz. This year, Lotte New York Palace is pulling out all the stops to make the holiday season an unforgettable experience for guests and visitors alike.

name: Rolf’s German Restaurant Is Open & Completely Decked Out For The Holidays
description: Rolf’s German Restaurant in Gramercy is an Instagram favorite year after year. With the extravagant floor to ceiling Christmas ornaments, twinkle lights and ribbon, they really know how to pull in a crowd. After remaining closed back in 2020due to COVID and indoor dining regulations, the photo-worthy spot had returned IN 2021 and is back again this year in all its Christmassy glory. Because it’s so popular, it’s best to make a reservation (call 212-477-4750or212-473-8718 between 9 a. m.

name: NYC’s Swanky New Cocktail Bar Is An Ode To The Mad Men Era
description: Where would the advertising moguls of Madison Avenue in the 1960s grab a drink in modern day? Agency of Record! This swanky new restaurant and cocktail bar located inside the Renwick Hotel in Midtown offers up an old-school, 1950s-60s panache. Legend has it F. Scott Fitzgerald and John Steinbeck used to frequent the same hotel back in the their time.

name: This NYC Pop-Up Is Serving A Free Four-Course Thanksgiving Meal That’s All About The Sides
description: According to a survey by same-day delivery service Shipt,51% of Americans would rather have a Thanksgiving without a turkey than a Thanksgiving without the sides,and the #1 side dish title goes to, drumroll, please…stuffing. Well, according to our opinion, that data is 100% correct. So imagine our delight when we found out that the pop-up of our dreams was opening in NYC this month that’s, quite literally,all about the stuffing. This Thanksgiving, Shipt is teaming up with Michelin Star Chef Charlie Mitchell of Clover Hill in BK (who wasnominated for a 2023 James Beard award as Emerging Chef of the year) at anexclusive pop-up restaurant coming to theEast Villagefor two days only. Aptly dubbed Sides, the pop-up willserve a series of innovative main-dish-worthy stuffing recipesso you don’t have to worry about cooking (and possibly burning) your Thanksgiving feast or having to make aThanksgiving dinner reservation.

name: 10 Best Brazilian Restaurants In NYC To Feast At Right Now
description: Inspired by the sizzling streets of Rio de Janeiro and the lush Amazon rainforest, Brazilian’s rich flavors and cuisine has made its way to New York City! From seasoned feijoada to sweet açaí, there’s tons of authentic South American food here just ready to be devoured. For this list, we’ve put together a list of our favorite spots, ranging from Brazilian steakhouses to hole-in-the-wall restaurants. Check them out below! This rodízio-style steakhouse in Midtown is one of NYC’s most popular Brazilian steakhouses.

name: 10 Best Places For Chicken Wings In NYC Right Now
description: Drums or flats? Wherever you stand on the great chicken wing debate, it won’t matter because you can find all of the best ones here in New York City! From Harlem’s smokybarbecue jointsto the sizzlingKorean-style wingsof Manhattan’s Koreatown, there are so many finger-licking places to grab some delicious wings. Check out our favorite spots below and satisfy your wing craving now! With multiple locations in NYC, Bonchon is famous for its Korean-style fried chicken wings with a choice of sauces.

name: An Immersive Pop-Up Pepsi Diner Experience Is Coming To Midtown NYC
description: On September 5, tickets will go on sale for The Pepsi 125 Diner, an amazing,immersive Pepsi dinerwhere everything is themed around the iconic American soda we all know and love. Fromphoto momentsandtableside entertainmentto a uniquePepsi food menu– you don’t want to miss this one-off event. Thepop-up restaurant experiencewill open its doors at a venue inMidtown NYC on October 19forone week only. It’s all in celebration of the 125th birthday of Pepsi, and diner guests will have the opportunity to relive some of themost famous Pepsi momentsof the last 125 years through the lens of music and pop culture. There will be anexhibition of one-of-a-kind Pepsi memorabiliawithcool photo ops, vintage commercials, music, and interactive elements to explore.

userId: Source / Photo of Singapore via Shutterstock/ Stockbym
name: A Vibrant Singaporean Food Festival Has Arrived In NYC
description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant flavors of Singapore at this year’sSingapore Food Festival. Happening from now throughSeptember 15th, participatingSingaporeanandSingaporean-owned restaurants and bars across North America are working withSingapore Tourism Board AmericasandSingaporeGlobal Network to launch adigital food passportthat couldland you a free trip to the island! Upon visiting one of theparticipating restaurants, be sure to scan the on-site QR code that will take you to the Passport landing page. From there, diners will be able to enter for the chance to be the lucky winner of a trip to the Lion City. The winner will get a 4-day/3-night trip to Singapore with a travel companion of their choice.

name: 17 Best Greek Restaurants In NYC For Mediterranean Cuisine
description: It’s no secret that we have world-famous cuisine that can transport you to just about anywhere on the globe. Outside of Europe, New York City is one of the best cities for Greek food, and there are so many fantastic restaurants in the city you need to stop by. From fresh seafood to baklava and everything in between, there’s nothing better than enjoying an authentic meal at a quality Greek restaurant. Whether you’re in the mood for a classic Greek diner or a Michelin-star restaurant, there’s a bit of something for everyone! Ready for a tastyMediterraneanexperience?

name: 25 Best Mexican Restaurants In NYC For Tacos And Tequila
description: NYC is one of the premier destinations in the world for delicious food from different cultures and regions. We proudly boast some of thebest Mexican restaurants, which can be found all over the city. With nearly 1,000 Mexican restaurants within the five boroughs, you’re bound to come across something tasty, whether you’re looking for anal pastor burrito or a plate of arroz con pollo. Since there are so many options, we narrowed it down to our favorite 25. Here’s what makes our list ofbest Mexican restaurants in NYC.

userId: Source / Photo: Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken
name: 15 Best Fried Chicken Spots In NYC To Devour Right Now
description: Calling all fried chicken enthusiasts! With National Fried Chicken Day coming up on July 6, we’ve put together our list of the best places to devour some delicious chicken. From classic southern-style chicken and waffles to irresistible buffalo sandwiches, these spots are whipping up the juiciest and golden brown meat around. Here’s where to satisfy your fried chicken craving right now. Let’s start with a Harlem staple, who’s name comes in honor of the legendary Harlem speakeasy that attracted neighborhood folk, jazz greats, and noteworthy figures of the 20th century.

name: 15 Spots To Find The Best Mac And Cheese In New York City
description: There’s no shame in ordering mac and cheese from a restaurant,especiallyif it’s from one of the places on this list! Fromcreamy rich classics, to over-the-top fusions, here are all the places in NYC with must-try mac and cheese dishes (and a map at the bottom to help find a spot nearest you): Sek’end Sun is anAstoriacocktail bar with tons of great cocktails and some of the best mac and cheese in NYC. Add pulled pork to their aged cheddar and parmesan mac for the perfect start to your meal (or as the whole meal, honestly). 📍32-11 Broadway Murray’s was on our list of the best grilled cheese in the city, and their mac and cheese delivers just as well. It’s made with cheddar, Gruyere, Gouda, and Scharfe Maxx—a dark, funky, and super melty Swiss cow’s milk cheese.

name: 7 Of The Coolest Themed Cafés And Restaurants In NYC
description: NYC’s got plenty ofcafés and restaurantsto choose from, and while they all seem alluring, we’ve got a penchant for themed locations this summer! Froman actual Central Perkand an adorable cat café to a hand-painted wonderland and everything in between, read on for our list. Where coffee’s concerned, Central Perk takes the crown! What used to be the stuff of dreams is now a reality atThe FRIENDS™ Experience, since you canactuallysit at Central Perk IRL! Sip on a coffee and enjoy one of the delicious pastriesbefore checking out the rest of the adventure:The FRIENDS™ Experiencein NYC is its very own flagship, where you can roam through set recreations, FRIENDS™ memorabilia and PIVOT!

name: Pizza Ramen Exists, & You Can Get It For A Limited Time At Ramen Go-To, Tonchin
description: Yeah, yeah, yeah, it’s officially summer, but that doesn’t mean we have tosay goodbye to soup–especially when it’s being paired with pizza! Yes, you heard us right. Brooklyn’s modern Japanese restaurant, Tonchin, has teamed up with Williamsburg pizza restaurant, Leo, for an absolutely irresistible collaboration–pizza ramen! The soup combines signature flavors from both restaurants–Leo’s mouthwateringmarinara sauce and sourdoughpair seamlessly with Tonchin’s signaturehandmade noodlesfor what we’d like to refer to as a bowl of heaven. The addition ofLeo’s hot oil, basil, parmesan, pecorino, and finally a grissini stickto top it all off make for one bowl of noodles you’ll definitely want seconds of.

name: 12 Best Sandwiches In NYC You Need To Devour Right Now
description: The verdict is in! We’ve scoured New York City to come up with the ultimate list of the best sandwiches thw city has to offer. Bringing New Yorkers the best of the best when it comes to slathered things between loaves of bread, we’re prepared to make your mouth water. From iconic NYC staples to hidden gems in Brooklyn, we’ve got some options that hold their own as the best sandwiches in NYC. We’d be remiss to start our list without mentioning the iconic sandwich that resides in the Lower East Side.

userId: Source / Photo: McSorley's Old Ale House/Facebook
name: 10 Oldest Bars In NYC You Can Still Sip Drinks At Today
description: Whether you’re a big history buff or simply just looking to grab a drink and a bite to eat, NYC is full of historical,and delicious,establishments. So when you’re in need of some libations and want to get a taste of how New Yorkers were dining and drinking centuries ago, just refer to our list below of theoldest bars in NYC. Who knows, you might just be sitting in the same seat that was once graced by Frank Sinatra or one of our Founding Fathers. Established in 1762, Fraunces Taverns holds the title as theoldest bar in the city. It’s a National Landmark complete with four different rooms (Independence Bar, Tallmadge Room, Hideout Bar, The Piano Bar Upstairs) and still continues to serve New Yorkers today.

name: Dine Al Fresco On A Sun-Soaked Atrium At Soho’s Dreamy New Dining Destination
description: The weather is warming up in more places than one, especially in Soho, where a new restaurant is claiming the title of the neighborhood’shottest new dining destination. The namesake restaurantTwenty Three Grandis delighting diners with global flavors and elevated classics with a Mediterranean flair–and the best part: their sun-soaked atrium with a retractable roof makes for the perfect lazy, summer afternoon spent dining al fresco. Thefemale-led kitchen, helmed by Executive Chef Ashley Rath, presents shareable–and absolutely crave-able–dishes that exude carefree energy in the best way possible. Caviar service, a raw bar consisting of tuna, beef, seabass, and carrot carpaccio all make for deliciously light bites. While burrata, pizettes, and a zucchini tower all make for equally as mouthwatering options.

name: This Backyard Garden Rooftop In The East Village Is A Perfect Spring Spot
description: The funkiest rooftop in New York City,The Ready at Moxy East Village, is back for another incredible season under the sun. The vacay vibes had never left this rooftop, even with theirtropical paradise holiday installation. But who wants to think about the winter holiday season when our futures are destined to be filled withrefreshing drinks and skyline views? ! Designed by the Rockwell Group, “The Ready evokes a coveted New York City backyard” and “feels like an escape from the New York daily grind,” said a press release.

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of Cull & Pistol
name: 20 Raw Bars And Happy Hours With The Best Oysters In NYC
description: Sure, New York might make you think of top-tier pizza and bagels, but don’t forget about the plentiful seafood options the city holds. Especially during the summertime, you can find some of the freshest finds around! With this list, we created the entire rundown on where you can find the best oysters in NYC, the best happy hour deals, and the best qualityseafoodin the city. Here are the spots that make our list: The Mermaid Innis first on our list, boasting three different locations around NYC. This New England-esque eatery comes complete with affordable seafood,$1.

name: Soak In Amalfi Coast Vibes At This Dreamy New Cocktail Bar In Chelsea
description: If you’ve been dreaming of an Italian getaway but your bank account is barely getting you a ride on the subway, let us introduce you toAlba Accanto,which is whisking NYers away on anAmalfi Coast adventurewithout having to leave NYC. In reality a trip to Alba Accanto places youbelow the High Lineon the ground floor of the Lantern House, though you’ll feel as if you’ve escaped straight to Positano. That’s to say the decor is allpastel colorsinspired by the grandeur of the Mediterranean including sculptural pieces, large-scale paintings, illustrated menus, and hand-painted tableware sourced straight from Puglia. “Will and I wanted to create a welcoming Italian-inspired experience in the spirited neighborhood of Chelsea that would provide a true glimpse of Positano,”says Cobi Levy of Prince Street Hospitality. “Our dedicated team has worked meticulously to curate the ultimate escape with a quality-driven menu of crudi, wines, and aperitivo-style cocktails to savor the elegant flavors of Italy while immersed in New York City’s infectious energy.

name: These Are The 2023 NYC James Beard Finalists
description: TheJames Beard Foundationhas been championing and supporting U. S. culinary culture for over 30 years, and along with fundraising efforts and events, is known for their coveted food industry awards. Their Restaurant and Chef Awards began in 1991, and their2023 list of finalistswas just revealed! Of course, living in one of the food capitals of the world,we’re privy to some amazing restaurantsand some of the top culinary talents, so plenty of NYC spots made the list!

userId: Source / Photo: Torch & Crown Brewing Company
name: 15 Best Breweries In NYC You Need To Check Out This Year
description: While Manhattan is a bit too cramped for such an endeavor, the outer boroughs of NYC are full of craft beer breweries that you can swing by for a visit! Stop by many of these independent brewers and behold their creations, which range from refreshing IPA’s and lagers to stouts and ales. With the warm weather approaching this spring, there’s never been a better time to stop in for a local pink. Check out our list of what we deem the 15 best breweries in NYC and stop in today: SingleCut was Queens’ first microbrewery and was actually the first to open after Prohibition. Their draft list is extensive and they also have a selection of house canned beers.

name: This Popular Los Angeles Hot Chicken Eatery Announces Expansion In NYC
description: There are few things more exciting than the news of a popular restaurant coming to NYC, and if you’re afan of Nashville hot chicken,you are in for a treat! L. A. ’s popularDave’s Hot Chickenopened its first New York City inMidtownduring August last year and was met with open arms. Don’t believe us?

name: Superiority Burger Is Bringing Late Night Grilled PB&Js & More To The East Village
description: If you’re a vegetarian or a vegan who really just misses a good ol’ juicy burger, we’re sure you’ve checked outSuperiorityBurger at least once for a tasty burger–and if you haven’t you’re in luck, because theirnew location is opening…. . soon. It won’t be the first time though! The first Superiority Burgeropened back in 2015by Brooks Headley and his team, according toGrubStreet.

name: NYC’s Iconically Racy Vegan Smash Burger Spot Has Expanded
description: Born in a two-bedroom Atlanta apartment back in 2018, Slutty Vegan made its cheekydebut appearance in Brooklynin September of last year, accumulating acrowd that filled an entire blockin Fort Greene (some people on line had even brought chairs to sit in while they waited…CHAIRS! ! ! ) Nearly six months later the vegan burger joint isstillgarnering lines down the block…so we’re happy to share the news that they’ve officiallyexpanded! Celebrating a grand opening last Tuesday, March 7, the restaurant is serving all their mouthwateringly iconicvegan burgers, sandwiches, and morefor takeout and delivery.

name: Veselka Aims To Open Two New NYC Locations This Year
description: The East Village, Ukrainian hotspot for delicious pierogis and borscht is aiming to open two new outposts in NYC! According to theNew York Post, one will open up inWilliamsburg, Brooklyn and the other as a kiosk inGrand Central Terminal. Ever since the war broke out in Ukraine, New Yorkers have settled on Veselka as the grounds for relief efforts, aidingUkrainian-owned businessesand donating funds to help those in need. It’s surplus of support over the past year or so has given the restaurant room for the expansion. Current relief efforts include donation drop offs at their East 9th Street entrance, in addition to a partnership with Razom For Ukraine.

name: 8 Best Places To Chow Down Yummy Korean Corn Dogs In NYC
description: If there’s one thing New Yorkers are known for when it comes to street food, it’s their passionate love of hot dogs. Though some Americans will debate you on which major city does it best (nice try,Chicago), every proud local of the Big Apple will be happy to remind you that our city does it best. Especially in K-town, where vendors gladly step outside the box and put a Korean-style flair on an already delicious corn dog. We’re talking extravagant toppings, flavorful drizzlings, and more.
