Here are some of our favorite Korean corn dog spots putting a twist on the classic New York-style dog.

name: Korean Barbecue Meets Fine Dining Flair At This New Brooklyn Spot
description: Korean soul is emphasized at Brooklyn’s newest fine Korean barbecue restaurantAtti. “When Koreans meet, instead of simply saying hello we ask if you’ve had a good meal,” readsAtti’s website. And if you were to have a meal at this new Korean barbecue spot before being asked this question, your answer would be a no hesitation “yes. ” How to know you’re in the right spot? A neon sign that reads“Meet the meat @ Atti”as well as the delicious smells of Korean barbecue filling the air.

name: 9 Best Restaurants For Tempura In NYC Right Now
description: Craving some deep-fried veggies or seafood selections? Here in New York we have some of the best Japanese cuisine around, from Michelin-starredomakase restaurantstoAYCE sushi joints. In this list though, we’re going to walk you through our favorites for tempura in NYC, a typical Japanese dish usually consisting of seafood, meat and vegetables that have been battered and deep fried. From formal establishments to street-side Boba tea cafes, these are the best places to go if you’re craving some crunch. If you’re looking for some cosmopolitan tempura in NYC, look no further than Blue Ribbon Sushi.

name: 15 Best Hamantaschen Across NYC
description: Who doesn’t love the holidays? They’re the perfect excuse to stuff your face with tasty treats! And sincePurim begins at sundown Monday, March 6thit only makes sense to kick off the celebration with some hamantaschen! Hamantaschen are triangle-shaped cookies, usually filled with fruit preserves, poppy seeds, even savory fillings. They are a Purim tradition resembling Haman’s tri-cornered hat, and a delicious tradition at that!

name: 12 Yummy Places With The Absolute Best Crepes In NYC
description: Most people associate crepes – a famous staple of French cuisine – with Paris, but they would be hard-pressed to find options more delicious than those found in NYC creperies. As a cultural melting pot, New York and France have many similarities believe it or not! From our divineFrench restaurantsandcafesto our top-tier crumblycroissants, to even our ownLittle Paris neighborhood(yes, we know! ! ), it’s no secret we’re quite a fan of the European influence.

name: Michelin-Starred Korean Steakhouse COTE To Open New 3-Floor Dining Concept
description: Simon Kim, the owner of one of our fav spots to grabKorean BBQin NYC, is opening a massive new3-story eateryin Manhattan’s Midtown, and our mouths are already watering at the thought. Michelin-starredCOTE, NYC’s first high-end Korean steakhouse, will get a new sister restaurantat 550 Madison Avenue,as reported by the NY Post. The Saudi investment company Olayan Group is currently completing a $300 million renovation of the building, including the new15,000-square-footdining concept, which will occupy the three lower levels. The restaurant, which is currently unnamed, will feature massive 60-foot ceilings with windows that overlook Madison Avenue and will provide diners with access to the tower’s new half-acre garden. Though theculinary style has not yet been decided, we have a pretty good inkling it will be delicious regardless of what direction they take.

name: 15 Best Places For Wine Tasting In NYC You Have To Try
description: Feeling up for a little wine tasting in NYC? It’s not only a summer activity, you know! With hundreds of venues and experiences always popping up, it can be overwhelming to find the perfect spot to find your next bottle. Especially if you have particular favorite types of wine (we’re personally on the sweeter side), it can be difficult to figure out where to find something that suits your tastebuds. While we wait for some of New York’s great vineyards to reopen this summer, let’s talk about some places right here in the city to do a little taste testing.

name: Chill At This New York City Rooftop Bar That’s Made Entirely Of Ice
description: Head to the Polar Lounge on Harriet’s Rooftop at 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge for what may be thecoolestbar experience in NYC! Some of you may remember the Minus5 bar that used to be in the New York Hilton Midtown, but sadly the spot has been closed for a few years. Since then NYC has been missing its very own ice bar that has become a popular attraction in cities such as Vegas & beyond. But not any more! Last year, Harriet’s Rooftop debuted Polar Lounge—a bar made entirely of ice—and it was such a success that it’s made a comeback for 2023!

name: 15 Best Chinatown Restaurants In NYC To Check Out Right Now
description: There are restaurants in Chinatown that have been around since the 1920s—like the well-known Nom Wah, a tea parlor that also offers delicious dim sum. Even with competitive eateries opening up in other NYC boroughs, Chinatown still has plenty of delicious spots that are worth visiting. But, like most things in NYC, the choices can absolutely be overwhelming. So we pulled together some spots that are a must-try if you’re eating in the area. Here’s our top 15: [Bonus spot:there’s a cart at 159 Hester Street called Cheong Fun Noodle that’s been serving amazing rice noodle and steamed noodle rolls for over 30 years.

name: Sip Swiss Wine In A 1970s Gondola At This Charming Bar In The West Village
description: Be transported to the heart of Switzerland’s french-speaking region atThe Lavaux, a wine & fondue bar in the West Village. Sharing the fabulous traditions of Swiss culinary and wine with NYC, explore the fruits of Lavaux’s terroir and taste signature flavors of the sunny, mountainous region’s wine and cheese. Deemed a World Heritage site by UNESCO, Lavaux produces some of the world’s best wine, as the region consists of hundreds of hectares of vineyards. Unfamiliar with Swiss wines? Learn everything you need to know from the experienced staff as you taste direct imports from Swiss winemakers.

name: This French Café May Have The Best Chocolate Chip Cookies In NYC
description: NYC’s beloved cafe chain, Maman, first opened in SoHo back in 2014 and rapidly expanded to multiple locations in Manhattan and Brooklyn. The quaint little cafe offers quality coffee, food and even a section dedicated to home decor. Maman, which means mother in French, is mainly inspired by the two founding partners’ childhood memories from the South of France. Their menu is largely focused on recipes they picked up from their moms, and it changes every day so you’re always in for a surprise when you come. Whether you’re in the mood for some baked goods, breakfast, brunch, lunch or a quick drink, Maman has it all—and a warm ambience that will make you feel right at home.

name: You Can Now Get The Cheesecake Factory Delivered Right To Your Door
description: With the holiday season in full swing, we’d be lying if we said we weren’t stressed. With all the cooking and baking we need to do it’s easy to get overwhelmed, and, while there’s nothing wrong with it, many of us resort to picking up a dessert at our local supermarket. Just in time for the holiday season, The Cheesecake Factory is lending Brooklyn natives a helping hand and delivering their world-famous cheesecakes as a sweet holiday treat! The Cheesecake Factory has launched adesserts-only delivery brandon DoorDash called “Famous Desserts by The Cheesecake Factory,” where they’ll deliver the same homemade cheesecakes they serve in their restaurants. Slicesof all the restaurant’s most loved flavors will be offered, including: Those that are looking for more than a slice can also order whole7″ cheesecakesthat serve 6-8 people featuring flavors like Ultimate Red Velvet, Oreo Dream Extreme, Godiva Chocolate, and Fresh Banana Cream.

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of Steve Freihon
name: 7 Best Spots In NYC To Order A Negroni, Sbagliato, With Prosecco In It
description: Negroni Sbagliatohas been quite the buzzword as of late, but let’s be real–it didn’t rise to popularity just because of how tasty it is. I’m sure we’ve all seen the viral TikTok video in whichHouse of the Dragonstar Emma D’Arcy mentions how her drink of choice is “a Negroni… Sbagliato… with Prosecco in it. ” And, in typical TikTok fashion, it didn’t take long for the clip to turn into a viral sound on the video sharing platform. Now, it’s being made and ordered in bars everywhere, and we seemingly can’t get enough! Contrary to the classic Negroni which contains equal parts gin, vermouth, and Campari, theSbagliato swaps the gin out for Prosecco.

name: 10 Cozy Hot Pot Restaurants In NYC You Need To Try
description: Grab some friends and bring your taste buds, because NYC’s Asian cuisine is no joke! In particular, the hot pot restaurants we have in NYC are some of the best, and have been incorporating many culinary traditions from across Asia for years and years. From beef-focused Japanese hot pots to spicy Sichuan situations, a hot bowl of broth, dipping ingredients, and sauces is the perfect warm meal during this time of the year! If you’re looking for an addictive Asian dinner, we’ve got some spots you need to try! You’ve maybe heard of99 Favor Tasteif you’re into hot pots in NYC because they have a few locations scattered around the city.

name: Get Disney’s Fan Favorite Dole Whip Delivered To Your Front Door
description: Disney fans know the deal. Dole Whip ice cream has a cult following that is unrivaled in the snack realm. And with National Dole Whip Day on Thursday, July 21st, Dole Packaged Food is bringing the sweet treat right here to NYC! Dole Whip fans will get the rare chance to enjoy the tropical dessert, that really only graces parts of Hawaii and amusement parks, with on-demand delivery—all you need to do is tweet! Lucky winners will get a FREE DIY Dole Whip Kit sent to their front door within hours.

name: 12 Best Bars In NYC For A Refreshing Aperol Spritz
description: Something about that bitter bite of Aperol with the slight sweetness of orange and fizziness of Prosecco makes for theperfectwarm-weather combo. And luckily, you have plenty of options to grab one in NYC, including to-go or for outdoor dining currently. Cheers to that! If sipping a spritz right on the water doesn’t scream summer, I don’t know what does! That’s why Island Oyster on Governors Island is the perfect spot to indulge.

userId: Source / House of Spirits: A Haunted Cocktail Soirée
name: Get Tickets To The New Season Of NYC’s Haunted Cocktail Party, ‘House Of Spirits’ Before It Ends
description: Prepare yourself for a night full of mystery and magic, paired perfectly with cocktails but it’s only here until Oct. 31. This fall, you are invited to a Halloween soirée at a stylish, but eerie mansion. House of Spirits: Volkov Manoris a two-hour immersive cocktail experience with a disquieting and interactive storyline that promises to leave guests delightfully chilled! The evening takes placeat amysterious five-story mansionlocated at 60 Pine St.

name: 5 Deliciously Boozy Spots To Enjoy Bottomless Dinner In NYC
description: Truth be told we all know that brunch is the absolute best weekend activity, and there’s nothing in the world that could replace abottomless brunch. However, what if we told you there was a little something called bottomless dinner? Yes, the rumors are true! Some restaurants are starting to offer bottomless dinner alongside their bottomless brunch, and we couldn’t be happier. And though bottomless brunch will always be our #1, bottomless dinner comes pretty dang close.

name: Midtown’s Enormous Food Hall The Hugh Is Open For Weekend Dining & Entertainment
description: Midtown’s newest food hall, The Hugh, opened up to the public last October on Lexington Avenue. The stylish food hall, which was previously only open on weekdays, first expanded their hours for weekend dining and entertainment in March and there’s tons of exciting upcoming programming to look forward to! The Hugh houses 15 incredible restaurants and bars, offering global cuisine including Jumieka NYC, Kazunori, Alidoro, Greenpoint Fish & Lobster Co. , Mah Ze Dahr, Teranga and more. Their new weekend dining program will bring exciting entertainment and activities to the food hall like cooking classes, tastings, trivia night, live music and more!

name: You Can Get Free Ice Cream In The Meatpacking District Today
description: An exciting KIND “ice cream truck-inspired tour” is traveling across the country, and NYC is the first stop on the tour! Head to the Meatpacking/High Line entrance atWashington St between W 13th & Little W 12thtoday to grab their creamy plant-based KIND FROZEN Treat Bars for FREE. Try flavors like Dark Chocolate Almond Sea Salt & Nut, Peanut Butter Dark Chocolate & Nut and the newest, Mint Chocolate Almond & Nut. Once spotting the truck, visitors will be surrounded by plants—a key ingredient in the frozen treats! “Since day one, KIND has been committed to creating innovative, premium foods that all lead with a nutrient-dense ingredient, but never sacrifice taste,” saysRussell Stokes, CEO at KIND North America.

userId: Source / Photo by Agathe Marty on Unsplash
name: Try NYC’s Best Espresso Martinis At This Themed Festival Coming In May
description: The first Espresso Martini Festival was started by premium coffee liqueur brand Mr Black back in Australia in 2016, followed by London, and now it’s coming to the states for the first time this month! Basically, for the full seven days between May 16-22, New Yorkers can get special$12 Espresso Martinis from NYC’s top cocktail bars and restaurants. Here are all the NYC bars & restaurants participating: The festival is also taking place in other U. S. cities including L.

name: 15 Outdoor Patio Dining Setups In NYC Perfect For The Warm Weather
description: When the weather finally warms up in New York City we’ll do all we can to be outdoors as much as possible, and that includes al fresco dining. Not all outdoor dining setups are created equal though, and it’s no secret that the atmosphere can make or break your entire meal. So, since the sun has finally come out of hiding and is bathing the city streets in all its shiny, warm goodness,here are some of the best restaurants with outdoor patio dining in NYC, perfect for the warm weather. Aldama is a Mexico City-inspired restaurant that offers delicious dishes such as Vegan Mole and Yellowtail Ceviche. Their outdoor patioopens on May 1stcomplete with overhead clay lamps, concrete walls, and an authentic Mexico City feel.

userId: Source / Facebook / Tompkins Square Bagels via @thefoodiefriend
name: 10 Best Places To Get A B.E.C. In NYC
description: Your mornings just got a whole lot better! Nothing quite hits on a Saturday morning like a hefty, mouthwatering B. E. C. And though the traditional way to eat it is on a roll, many places serve them up on a chewy, deliciousNYC bagel.

name: Lullaby Is Serving Disney’s Beloved Dole Whip, But With A Boozy Twist
description: Lullaby is whipping up the latest cocktail experience heading to the LES. Officially opening to the public March 10, the new laissez-fare bar comes from partners Harrison Snow and Jake Hodas. The duo was set on creating an environment for people to enjoy world-class cocktails without all the fuss. Their menu echoes this sentiment with their instructions to “just drink it and shut up. ” Imagine top-tier cocktails meets dive bar atmosphere.

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of Pinto Garden
name: 10 Best Bottomless Brunch Spots In The West Village
description: It seems as if going to brunch has become the go-to weekend plan…every single weekend. But if we’re being honest here, we’re not complaining. If you’re looking to switch up your usual go-to brunch spot this weekend, here are10 of the best spots to get bottomless brunch in the West Village area. Bon appetite! For $47 at The Crooked Knife there’s a huge selection of entrees to choose from (5 eggs Benedict choices, pancakes, French toast, burgers, and salads) and 90 minutes of unlimited mimosas and bloody marys.

userId: Source / Justine Golata for Secret NYC
name: This Hidden Gem Is Serving Cocktails Underneath The 50th Street Subway Station • Nothing Really Matters
description: This hidden NYC gem is serving up mouthwatering cocktails beneath beaming lights for an exciting new spot that should be on every NYers radar. Make your commute a little more interesting when you stop for a drink at the 50th Street subway station on the downtown 1 line. Yes, literally inside the station. You’ll forget all about your original destination once you discover this unassuming cocktail bar beneath Manhattan’s streets. First opened in the new year, “Nothing Really Matters” gives you an intimate experience without the intimidation.

userId: Source / The Deco, credit to Max Lau
name: This Gorgeous 1920s Art Deco Food Hall Just Reopened In The Garment District
description: Owner Doris Huang first thought of the idea while working in an office in the neighborhood on 34th St. and 8th Ave. She knew the area was centrally located in Manhattan, but didn’t have many options for food and drink. So, she set out to turn the area into a new delicious destination. The beautifully designed food hall first opened in December 2019, but sadly closed during the pandemic in September of 2020.

name: Los Tacos No.1 Opens New NoHo Location
description: Los Tacos No1 opened their first NoHo location today and they’re celebrating by offeringfree tacosfrom 11 a. m. – 2 p. m. today (1/5).

name: Cheese Protects You From All Causes Of Death, Says Science
description: A bigdziękito our friends in Poland: namely Professor Maciej Banach of the University of Łódź. For Banach and his plucky team of researchers have just completed a thrilling meta-analysis of 29 cohort studies that confirm what we’ve always chosen to believe: cheese can help you not die. Thus spoke the scientists: ‘cheese and yogurt were found to protect against both total mortality — death from any cause — and mortality from cerebrovascular causes. ’ Verily, it is the shield that can protect us against the slings and arrows of modern life, including stroke and heart attack, according to the European Society of Cardiology, whichpresented the research. Studying over 20,000 adults over 11 years, consumption of this food was associated with an 8% lower total mortality risk.

name: Netflix’s ‘Nailed It!’ At-Home Experience Is Back With A Summery, Marine-inspired Challenge!
description: Following the wildly successful launch ofNailed It! : Double Trouble! earlier this year, the popular at-home bake-off series is coming back with a new summery challenge. The new season, which is now streaming on Netflix, features double the contestants and double the mayhem, and once again you’re invited to partake in the pandemonium from home. Netflix has teamed up with Fever to bring the newNailed It!

name: This Brand New Brunch In Midtown Is The Perfect Weekend Plan For Spring
description: And this brand-new brunch on a beautiful outdoor terrace in the heart of the city is a much-try. Renowned hotel and resort group RIU just opened a new hotel in Times Square, and recently launcheda brunch at its beautifully designed Fashion Bar & Restaurant. Choose from classic brunch dishes like eggs benedict, traditional Mexican huevos rancheros, pancakes and French toast, or healthier options like fruit and cereal bowls. Or, stick with lunch and choose from hamburger or their famous pork ribs. And don’t forget the cocktails!

name: Netflix’s Nailed It! At Home Experience Is Double The Trouble And Double the Fun!
description: April’s Nailed It! Bake Off is an epic ode to the humble hamburger and fries and we are so here for it. Yep, the head chefs at theNailed It! Headquarters have done it again with a recipe inspired by a challenge in the new season ofNailed It! Double Trouble.

name: This Queens Restaurant Serves Delicious Multi-Colored Soup Dumplings • Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao
description: Nan Xiang Xiao Long Bao—named after the Nan Xiang County of Shanghai, China where “soup dumplings” (or xiao long bao) originated—first opened in Flushing, Queens in 2006. It closed in the summer of 2019 to move locations, and reopened in November of that year in a new spot atOne Fulton Square in Flushing. Long known for their incredible soup dumplings (they’ve been selected as Michelin-recommended Shanghainese food for nine consecutive years), their new location also included some menu upgrades, like these pretty, pastel-colored soup dumplings! They are called the steamed “Lucky Six Soup Dumplings. ” The flavors include the signature (pork), crab meatandpork, black truffle, Chinese squash, Chicken, and Foie Gras (seasonal special) according totheir Facebook page.

name: A Nutella Lover’s Guide To NYC
description: Well even if there somehow is, this guide is for theloversof Nutella. The ones who could eat Nutella on theirpancakesfor breakfast, in their baguette for lunch, and in their ice cream for dessert. We’ve rounded up all of the things in NYC youmusteat if you have a passion for this chocolate hazelnut spread, perfect for what has to be the most mouthwatering food tour in all of NYC. While theirpizzais incredible, the dessert menu at tiny SoHo restaurant Song E’Napule is basically a love letter to Nutella. And the pièce de résistance is the “Pallone di Maradona,” which translates to the “Maradona ball.

name: 9 Of The Best Bakeries For Chinese Pastries In New York City
description: Nonetheless, we’ve tried to narrow it down here. From mooncakes to roll cakes to those darn delicious buns, there’s a bit of everything. Check out this list of 9 of the best Chinese bakeries in New York City. Mooncakes are a traditional pastry typically eaten around the Mid Autumnal Festival in September or October. However, Lung Moon specializes in making them all year round.

name: The Team Behind UWS Fave ‘Jacob’s Pickles’ Just Opened A Cheery New Tiki Bar • Tiki Chick
description: Now the team, who also runs Maison Pickle and Lucky Pickle Dumpling Co. , just opened a retro tiki bar called “Tiki Chick” that will bring chill island vibes to the Upper West Side. Tropical cocktails are one of the main components, divided into the three categories of “Tiki Classics,” “Tiki Originals” and “Frozens. ” Classics include a “Singapore Sling” with a banana-infused Brooklyn-made Old Tom gin, while the originals include a “Fish Face” with cachaca, guava, coffee and absinthe. Oh, and there areplentyof frozen drink options.

name: Nutella Soup Dumplings Are Real, And You Can Only Get Them On St. Marks Or In Queens
description: Located on Main Street in Flushing, Queens,Kung Fu Xiao Long Baowas there long before its spinoff The Bao found its home on St. Mark’s. Although both places serve this sweet dish, the Queens outpost was the original and some argue it’s still better than The Bao (but we highly recommend making your own decision on that…after all, they’re both run by the same owner). The delicious dumplings are filled with pieces of banana along with a sizable serving of melted Nutella! Although nottechnicallyfilled with soup, the melted Nutella takes on a “soup” consistency when melted.

name: Queens Night Market Adds New Vendors To Its List Of International Cuisine
description: The open-air market has been around since 2015 and with each year gets larger and more popular. So far during the 2019 season, the Queens Night Market has been averaging over 12,000 visitors per night! Their varied cuisine pulls from restaurants around the world representing food from 90 countries. The team behind the market also decided to make some changes this year in compared to last by opening an hour earlier, doing away with the beer and wine garden partition, and lowering vendor fees; all of which have increased vendors sales and created a more family friendly environment. The most notable part of the event for New Yorkers, however, is that all food options have a price cap of $5 (with only a few $6 exceptions).

name: 4 Restaurants In NYC To Celebrate National Eggs Benedict Day
description: https://www. instagram. com/p/Bvor6gxlqws/ You might recognise the name from various food-porn pics that influencers love to post whenever frequenting Paris… particularly those who come to visit during Fashion Week. Their avocado benedicte is to die for, with a base of english muffins, poached eggs, avocado cream, hollandaise sauce and a few spices. Make sure you check outShort Storiesat 355 Bowery to enjoy Season’s brunch pop-up while it’s still around.

name: The Best Burger In Chicago, Au Cheval Is Finally Opening In NYC Next Week
description: When it comes to the best burger in NYC, everybody has their own favorite, and why wouldn’t they? Burgers are juicy, cheesy, and (mostly) economical. But what makes the best burger? Is it the filling to bun ratio? Is it the cook on the meat?

name: Spiciest Curry In The World Is Served As A Challenge In NYC’s East Village
description: Phaal curry is a British-Indian dish known to be the hottest in the world, and at Brick Lane Curry House it’s so hot that thex chef has to wear a gas mask while making it to not choke on the spicy fumes released. Their website even describes the order as: “An excruciatingly hot curry, more pain and sweat than flavor. For our customers who do this on a dare, we require you to state a verbal disclaimer not holding us liable for any physical or emotional damage after eating the curry. ” The dish is created using about 10 to 12 ground chili peppers, including the hottest one—Carolina Reaper. Once finished and served it has a heat of about 2.

name: Raclette NYC Is The Cheesiest Experience You’ll Have In New York
description: If you’re more of acheese connoisseurthan say, a casualgrilled cheeselover, Raclette will be right up your alley. Named for the traditionalFrenchand Swizz practice of melting glorious, smelly cheese over your meal, this restaurant serves up the most authentic and reasonably priced raclette in the city. Descartes may have said “Cogito ergo sum” (I think, therefore I am), but we add: ‘Curdy-to ergo yum,” which–in the universal language of fromage–loosely translates to: “I ate this cheese and it was delicious! ! ” Thanks to the great @luiza for stopping by our humble spot last week and having our burger with smoked raclette.

name: This All-Avocado Restaurant Is Opening A Manhattan Location
description: Avocaderia is a fast, casualavocado based restaurantwith a new location in Manhattan! The restaurant was founded with the intention to offer city dwellers fresh, healthy, and tasty meals. They use avocados in every dish ranging from a selection of toasts to smoothies, lunch bowls to guacamole. Hello avo lovers! Can you imagine a better mate than his highness Prince Salmon to enjoy the sun with?

name: A Warhol-Themed Bar Just Opened in Brooklyn, and it’s Bananas!
description: The Brooklyn bar scene keeps popping up with fun and creative spots to grab a drink—and we’re all here for it! https://www. instagram. com/p/BbspV9cAnzf/? taken-by=silverfactorynyc The bar’swalls are painted silverto match, withphotographs of Warholhimself.

name: NYCs Bucket list for Vegetarians
description: Being a vegetarian can be hard in a lot of states, but if you live in New York or are visiting, you’re in luck. There are as many vegetarian options as there are restaurants for meat lovers, and they run the gamut of flavors. Whether you call NYC home or are just here for a short while, you’ve got visit these vegetarian places to really live your life to the fullest. If you haven’t eaten at Dirt Candy, you haven’t lived. This is vegetarian at its finest, and fanciest, in this Allen Street eatery.

name: 7 New York-inspired Cocktails And How To Make Them (It’s Easy)
description: With such a wide choice ofincredible cocktail bars in NYC, mixing your own drinks feels a little like going on vacation to Rome and packing pizza ingredients. There are plenty of places to try acocktail named after New York, but goddammit if you won’t look sexy as hell when you ask the hottie at your next party where in New York they’re from and you shake up one of these little beauties for them. [Science of Drink]Ingredients:2oz rye whisky1/2oz sweet vermouth1 dash Angostura bitters1 Maraschino cherry Recipe: Pour all the ingredients (minus the cherry) into a cocktail glass. Now add ice and stir. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
